question_title: what is wrong with the confederate flag? [SEP] question_content: Why does everyone assume that the Rebel Flag (Confederate) hate it so much? Im just wondering. and why does everyone assume its always used for raceism instead of Heratige, when its actually a battal flag for the south? [SEP] best_answer: Many people believe that the only reason the Civil War was fought was because of slavery. In reality, though, the War's principal reason for starting was because many southerners did not agree that men who lived hundreds of miles away had the right to dictate their way of life (back then, the distance from D.C. to Georgia or South Carolina made them seem like seperate countries-no airplanes). To most people, the Confederate flag represents racism for that very reason. My great-great-great grandaddy died wearing a Confederate uniform, and by reading his journals, I understand why he chose to do so. My family never owned slaves-we were dirt poor in the 1800's-, but he honestly believed in states rights, and that a federal government had no right to decide what was right or wrong for him. I don't care that the South lost the war-it was almost 150 years ago! But like the great General Lee said of the men who served the Confederacy: They gave more than they were asked to give, and they gave it without complaint. That's enough for me-I'll always show respect to the Confederate flag, and honor the men who died under it, fighting for something they believed in.

question_title: Im gay, but im only attracted to straight men.....what to do? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Dude! I have exactly the same problem. Living in a very conservative area I do it alot. Here are some tips on how to get around it based on what I do.
-Surround yourself with girlfriends and talk to them about it. They always come together and help you forget about the guy.
-Make a real effort to become friends with him. It may sound counter preductive but if you start to see him as a friend instead of a sex object then that is better and potentially more rewarding. I did this and that's how I found one of the best friends I've ever had.
-Visit gay bars and have sex. I know that this sounds rather immoral and disgusting but it could work.
-Find a hobby and immerse yourself in it. That way you can meet new people who are interested in the same things and help you to move on.

There are many other ways too. You end up picking the one which feels best for you. But there is ALWAYS a solution.

Good luck buddy.

question_title: What kind of proof would you accept to convert to another religion? [SEP] question_content: This has been a question on my mind for awhile. I would like to hear opinions as to what people would take for conclusive evidence that another religion has enough to interest you.

Have a great day! [SEP] best_answer: First, I would have to have some reason to think that my current belief is wrong.  I believe the Bible, and it is historically accurate and without contradiction (despite the charges of those who have never read it).  It is supported by evidence, both internal and external.

Next, I would have to be convinced that the other religion is correct.  It is possible for two contradictory beliefs to both be wrong, but they cannot both be right.  Does it agree with history and science?  Is it internally correct, or is it filled with contradiction?  What is the character of the founder(s)?  There is a major world religion (which I will not mention here) whose founder claimed that he took a stairway to heaven and saw the stars as literally made of silver and hanging from silver chains from the ceiling.  Nothing could make be convert to that religion.  Another was founded by a convicted con man, who said that he could find water on your farm by looking at a rock in his hat.  One was started by a woman who had 'visions of heaven' after severe head trauma.

question_title: Christians and Atheists?? [SEP] question_content: Do you guys ever really try to see the other side of the Argument? Athiests? Have you ever really read the bible? Or been to church?  Christians and other religious folks, Have you ever really read Charles Darwins books? Not just heard something your Pastor said about evolution I mean really read his books?  And do you each think that you try as hard as you can to see the other side of the argument? [SEP] best_answer: Atheist here, and yes, I have indeed tried to see the other side of the arguement.

I was raised Lutheran from infancy, so I've got 20+ years of Christian teachings under my belt. Went to church services and Sunday School weekly. With my family not going was NOT an option. I also own a Bible as a result of Sunday School attendance. New Revised Standard Version(NRSV), not a King James or any other version, but it's a Bible nonetheless. And yes, I have read it. The most recent time was this summer.

So there's no way that I'm unqualified to speak on religious matters as far as Christianity's concerned.

When I answer questions on here or the rare times I'm able to speak with someone personally about religion and not end up in a fight over it, I try to see their side of the arguement, provided they haven't jumped right into insults and "You're wrong" and "You're going to burn in Hell" sort of crap right off the bat. Unfortunately, a lot of people where I live do just that, so you can see why it's rare I'm able to speak civilly with people in my hometown about religion.

When it comes to insults and bigotry, I don't even bother. I walk away from people who talk like that to me in person and on YA, if I see questions I feel are biased or worse, I don't even bother to answer them. If a person's honest and polite, I'm all too happy to answer. If a person's just being an obnoxious jerk, I don't even waste my bandwidth.

With polite people, I do try to see their side of the arguement, especially when I do already understand Christianity. When it comes to other religions I'm not as familiar with, even though I might not fully understand them, I try to, and I do defend other religions as I know that religion itself isn't a bad thing. No truly bad religions, just bad followers.

Yes, I have even defended Christianity more than once. I defended it just a few minutes ago with the question I answered just before this one about the whole church and state and prayer in school issue. A lot of Christians think they don't have the right to pray in a public school, but I've looked into that myself for the last ten years.

Just because it was decided in 1963 that it wasn't right and constitutional to require kids to recite a prayer(from my mother, it sounds like it was usually the Lord's Prayer, at least when she was young. Seeing as how the ruling was made long before I was born, I can't say if that was standard or just what my mother's school did), doesn't mean Christianity is "banned". Christian kids can freely pray or read the Bible or hold Bible clubs(if they allow things like photography clubs, they can allow Bible and other religious clubs as well) or invite another classmate to join them for services.

I might be an atheist and I might not want my own children to have to recite the Lord's Prayer or any prayer in school, doesn't mean I won't stand up for the rights of Christians and anyone else who's religious to have their beliefs at school, or when holding office, or whatever. Just because you step into a public place, doesn't mean you have to leave your beliefs at home. All it means is that you have to be aware and respectful of others and that goes for everyone.

I was raised Christian and had my own beliefs(and eventually nonbelief as I was sort of paganistic for a time before I turned to atheism) stepped on and treated as if I was undeserving before. My own family has unfortunately taken to this sort of behavior from time to time. It's happened to me way too many times, so I'm not about to do it to anyone else.

I have gone to church, I've read the Bible, I've studied church and state matters and tried to learn about and understand other religions for some time. I've had painful personal experiences when it comes to my beliefs being stepped on.

question_title: how do i find the right church and join it? [SEP] question_content: I am a single mom with 3 kids.  My daughter is 6 months old and is mixed in race.  I have not attended a church in probably 10 years but I feel that it is something my children and I are missing in our lives.  I do not even know where to start looking.  I feel like an outcast because of my situation.  I do not have a lot of money because i am a nursing student.  i feel like they look down on me because of this.  our town is pretty small and it seems like only the people with money go.  please help i want to go but dont understand how to find or begin going. [SEP] best_answer: Money should never ever be an issue.  If you feel that a church looks down on you, either you're over sensitive or they have a real problem.  In a good congregation nobody is an outcast.  I'm also a student with very little money but I feel more than welcome in my church, and even sing in the choir and help with creche.  

If you went to church as a kid then start with a church of that denomination.  Otherwise just start with your nearest one.  A library or information centre will have a list of churches and sevice times and many have their own websites.  

Starting to go is easy, you just need to pluck up the courage to walk in to a church on the Sunday morning.  There's no preparation involved, you don't need any contacts there.  You should recieve a warm welcome, as churches are always trying to bring more people in.  Hang around after the service, most churches do refreshments and you'll have a chance to introduce yourself to the minister and members of the congregation and get a feel for the place.  You'll probably find that not everybody is rich, and everybody will want to be friends with you.  

Go to each church in the area for a couple of weeks, as one visit won't always be enough for an accurate impression, then make a decision as to which one you prefer. 

If you don't have one which is nearer than the others, baptist and methodist churches tend to be friendly (this is coming from the U.K so bear in mind if you're not in Britain the denominations may be different), so they would be good to start with.

Do go for it, it will be the best thing you ever do.

Light lamps for victims: Vanamamalai Jeer

By Our Special Correspondent

CHENNAI, JULY 20. Kaliyan Vanamamalai Ramanuja Jeer of the Vanamamalai Mutt today called upon the people to light traditional lamps in their homes and nearby temples tomorrow (around 6 p.m.) and observe a two-minute silence in memory of the July 16 Kumbakonam fire victims.

In a statement, the Jeer said the Mutt and its branches and the temples would do so.

The Government and the people should take efforts to ensure that such accidents did not recur.

The School Teachers Federation of India urged the State Government and the Centre to ensure safety in schools.

`Take action against managements'

In a statement, the State president, K.Rajendran, said action should be taken against managements, which failed to provide safety and basic facilities in schools.

question_title: My BF told me not to take the Porshe through the car wash because it ruin the paint, what's wrong with  paint? [SEP] question_content: Please explain why an automatic car wash would hurt the paint. [SEP] best_answer: There is nothing wrong with the paint on the Porshe. The problem is that car washes do damage to paint jobs whether it is a Bentley or a Kia. The ones with the brushes will leave microscopic scriches in the paint that will allow water and other elements to further damage the paint job. Touchless ones don't always remove all the cleansing agents and again can corrode the paint job. With run of the mill cars (ones 95% of us drive) owners don't really care. A Toyota with imperfections in the paint is still just a Toyota and most feel the effort taken to hand wash the car is more valuable than the paint job. Your boyfriend bought a Porshe because... well I don't know but after spending that kind of money he wants it to look as good as possible for as long as possible.

question_title: What is Eid al Adha? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Eid ul-Adha (Arabic: عيد الأضحى) occurs on the tenth day of the Islamic month of Dhul Hijja. It is one of two Eid festivals that Muslims celebrate. Eid ul-Adha is celebrated by Muslims worldwide as a commemoration of Prophet Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son for God.

Muslims believe that God revealed in a dream to Ibrahim (Prophet Abraham) to sacrifice his son Isma’il. Ibrahim and Isma’il set off to Mina for the sacrifice. As they went, the devil attempted to persuade Ibrahim to disobey God and not to sacrifice his beloved son. But Ibrahim stayed true to God, and drove the devil away. As Ibrahim prepared to sacrifice his son, God stopped him and gave him a sheep to sacrifice instead. The story is also a part of the other Abrahamic religions

It is celebrated on the 10th day of the month of Dhul Hijja (ذو الحجة) of the lunar Islamic calendar, after Hajj, the annual pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia. This happens to be approximately 70 days after the end of the month of Ramadan.

While Eid ul-Fitr is considered to be three days, Eid ul-Adha is supposed to be four days. The first day is the primary holiday, on which men, women, and children are expected to dress in their finest clothing and perform prayer (Salah) in a large congregation. Muslims who can afford to do so sacrifice domestic animals, usually sheep, as a symbol of Ibrahim's sacrifice; this sacrifice is called "Qurban." The meat is distributed amongst their neighbors, relatives, and the poor and hungry. The charitable instincts of the Muslim community are demonstrated during Eid ul-Adha by the concerted effort to see that no impoverished Muslim is left without sacrificial food during this day. Coming immediately after the Day of Arafat (when Muhammad pronounced the final seal on the religion of Islam), Eid ul-Adha gives concrete realization to what the Muslim community ethic means in practice.

Pakistan
Official Language: Urdu and English

Bhutan

Sri lanka
Official Language: Sinhala and Tamil

Bangladesh 
Official Language: Bangla ( or Bengali) 
National Dress: no national dress but they usually wear kurta-pajama or lungi (men) and sari or salwar kameez (women)

China
Official Language: Standard Mandarin (Putonghua)

Afghanistan
Official Language: Pashto and Dari

Myanmar
Official Language: Burmese

question_title: Spirit vs soul? [SEP] question_content: Whats the difference between spirit and soul ,is one mind and the other emotions? [SEP] best_answer: Precisely the same Hebrew phrase used of the animal creation, namely, ne'phesh chai·yah' (living soul), is applied to Adam, when, after God formed man out of dust from the ground and blew into his nostrils the breath of life, “the man came to be a living soul.” (Ge 2:7) Man was distinct from the animal creation, but that distinction was not because he was a ne'phesh (soul) and they were not. Rather, the record shows that it was because man alone was created “in God’s image.”  He was created with moral qualities like those of God, with power and wisdom far superior to the animals; hence he could have in subjection all the lower forms of creature life.  Man’s organism was more complex, as well as more versatile, than that of the animals. (1Co 15:39.) Likewise, Adam had, but lost, the prospect of eternal life; this is never stated with regard to the creatures lower than man.

Soul, A Living Creature

As stated, man “came to be a living soul”; hence man was a soul, he did not have a soul as something immaterial, invisible, and intangible residing inside him. The apostle Paul shows that the Christian teaching did not differ from the earlier Hebrew teaching, for he quotes Genesis 2:7 in saying: “It is even so written: ‘The first man Adam became a living soul.’ The first man is out of the earth and made of dust.” 1Co 15:45-47.

The Genesis account shows that a living soul results from the combination of the earthly body with the breath of life. The expression “breath of the force of life [literally, breath of the spirit, or active force (ru'ach), of life]” (Ge 7:22) indicates that it is by breathing air (with its oxygen) that the life-force, or “spirit,” in all creatures, man and animals, is sustained. This life-force is found in every cell of the creature’s body

question_title: (a) WHAT  IS behind a needy person's automatic need to need? [SEP] question_content: (b) does it come from the environment  not giving that person what they need or is it a mechansim from the past - childhood?  \n\n(c) Can a needy person's needs ever be satisfied or are they a bottomless pit? [SEP] best_answer: What you perceive as a needy persons "Automatic" need to need may not be so automatic after all. For example if you enter a room and a baby starts to cry,,,you may perceive that to be an automatic need,  to need to be fed. When in reality perhaps the baby has been hungry for quite some time, and cried out to have that need met to the next person who entered the room.UN fulfilled needs come from both childhood and environment. I don't believe people are bottomless pits of needs . most will know when they are satisfied. It is only when one cannot determine need from want that neurosis manifests.

question_title: What is the average size of a mans penis? If a number is to be assigned, generally about 5-6 inches is average, with moderate girth.  There are, obviously, some who seem to tip the scales further in one direction or another.  I would caution anyone against putting too much stock in size, as there are so many variables in sexual compatibility.  If the only basis for interest is a number, the person is interchangable.  No one wants to feel interchangable.

question_title: My best friends sister has just died............? [SEP] question_content: I don't know what to say. I have never experienced this myself so i have no idea what she is going through.
Any one with any ideas on what to do or say is much appreciated.  So far all iv'e done is offer to do her washing.................. [SEP] best_answer: If she has kids, offer to watch them so that she can visit her sister's grave.

Plant a tree on her grave that will bloom flowers.  It will be nice for your friend to have a shady place to sit when she visits her sister and to see something strong and beautiful, which may reflect how she remembers her sister being.  Not only that, but it will make her sister's grave distinct and unique in the cemetery - she'll always be able to find her if she knows where the tree with the pink flowers is.

Talk to her about her sister comfortably, let her share, and share what you remember about her.

Offer to go with her to the cemetery and bring something to leave at the gravesite that you know her sister would like (favorite kind of flowers, windchimes, pictures, etc).

If you have any pictures or home videos that include her sister in them, make copies and give them to her.

If you have access to a lot of pictures of her and her sister, make a nice arrangement of them and frame them for her.

This might sound strange, but I know it's been done - Go with her to her sister's favorite place (park, lake, playground) and carve her name on a tree or into a stone if you can.  It's a way of leaving a physical mark that this person lived and was in that place.  It will be something that she can go back to and see and remember.  It sounds like an odd tribute, but it really can be meaningful.

Offer to go with her to the funeral, wake, burial, family reception, etc.  Do not assume that this is for family only, and do not make her ask you.  Just ask if you can be there for her at these things.  She needs you more than you know.

question_title: If you were me, How would you respond to my Girlfriend's e-mail? Please help - thankyou!!? [SEP] question_content: Sexy Bill,
 
What a wonderful Wednesday it was, I just wanted to write you and thank you again since I was unable to write much yesterday morning due to the workload at hand. It was positively wondrous to be close to you, and to make love, which is out of this world. 
 
I have to tell you, I am so impressed with your spirit in willingness to honor my request for more space that I feel closer to you than ever. You displayed an unprecedented level of understanding and wisdom, I am beside myself with admiration and respect for you. You never fail to show me the light when I have doubts. I only hope that I treat you as well as you deserve to be treated, because you are worthy of only the best and nothing less. 
 
Looking at the whole, the only thing that I've had trouble with is how much you give, which is almost to an extreme, since you have such a generous heart. I can't help but to feel bad because I'm not in a position to give as much in return. At the same time I understand that is how you demonstrate your feelings, and I respect that. 
 
I want to apologize that, I realize I've pretty much made it all about sex. That is shallow of me. I suppose I tried to justify it in my own mind by thinking that, as a man, maybe that is all you would care about too. But I am really a jerk for thinking alongs those lines-- you are a human being with feelings, not just a hot body and handsome face. 
 
The more I find you reaching out to me with personal things such as sharing pictures with me, and showing/giving me things from your childhood, sends a message. Today I was puzzling over this outpouring, not knowing really what to do. My initial reaction unfortunately is to try to avoid getting too personal. But I started to think about how what a person shares is also what a person needs-- and maybe that I was treating you like an object. Like a sweet-hearted protest, you are showing me that you are more than just a toy. Like that toy doll in my dream that suddenly spoke, I've suddenly come to realize what's going on. I can see that you really want and need a special connection, and it's sad that I tend to do the exact opposite and vigilantly avoid everything that is romantic, sentimental, and personal. I don't know how to change this, but I think by ignoring your attempts to make a connection I am only making matters worse.
 
At least by acknowledging your needs I hope that you can see the level that I care about you. I am making my own attempt to figure out how to treat you right. I just wanted you to know that.
 
Have a joyful and happy Friday, looking forward to talking to you sometime this weekend.
 
Hayley [SEP] best_answer: Why do you ask the same question over and over and over???
the e-mail sounds fake..

question_title: help i dont know what to do? [SEP] question_content: ok theres this guy i like and i dont no if he likes me and were good friends and i think i want to tell him i like him but i dont want it to reck are friendship [SEP] best_answer: It depends partly on how old you are.  Until a guy is around 13 or 14, he does not know how to deal with those special feelings toward a girl.  So for a 13 year old guy friend, you're kind of out of luck.  Just keeping being a supportive friend.

For a guy 14 or over, you can give it a try.  First start by talking about dancing and see if the thought of dancing with a girl appeals to him.  Then hold his hand when you're walking together for a few seconds and see how he reacts.  If he is still smiling, then ask him if he wants a hug or something.  Then if he  has not turned to run yet, you can start off the conversation by saying you want to be friends most of all.  But there is something you have to clarify, and you are asking because you want to protect your friendship.   When people get to be a certain age, they start to think about the opposite sex in a "different way", and you are starting to be in that situation.  Then you ask if your friend would be offended if you told him how you feel about him.

If he is not ready, he would change the subject or look really scared.  Then  you'll know.  He won't be offended because you've already prepped him and warned him not to be offended.

Openness is very important if you are friends already and want to move on to something else.  When you grow up, you'd want to communicate with your boyfriend of husband in the same, gradual way.

question_title: How can you know if a guy has even any interest in you and how do you make them express it? [SEP] question_content: I mean like, how can you get his attention, how do you know if he likes you and  well, anything else I should know. [SEP] best_answer: Just like with girls, there's no one type of guy.  Some are more self-confident and some are shyer.  Some guys think that EVERY girl wants him, and some wouldn't believe that a girl is interested in him unless she came up and told him to his face, and even THEN he still may not believe it. 
To get his attention, you might try something as simple as starting a conversation with him and see where that goes.  Find something the two of you have in common that you can use as an excuse to spend time with him.  Don't be overly aggressive, pushy, or trampy; I know that works on TV, but not in the real world.  Plus, do you really want a guy who thinks you're overly-aggressive, pushy, or trampy?

There's a book by Shaunti and Jeff Feldham called "For Men Only" where her and her husband did research on what women want and think, and their (women's) perspective on things that men THINK they know, but really don't.  Believe it or not, men and women really do think differently.  It was a real eye-opener for me.  They have another book called "For Women Only" that's the same thing, but for women.

Good luck!

question_title: what should i do i told m cousin to never call me again because she cursed me out yesterday? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Wait a couple of days and let the boiling water cool. If you and your cousin are close, then she may undoubtedly call you first to apologize. If she does not, then I would call her perhaps on Monday, and apologize for your part, then stress to her, in a mature manner, that she hurt you. Now, I say this all the time to young girls, when we hurt someone, we must never say, "I'm sorry you felt this way." By saying it that way, you place the blame on the other person, and pretend that they have the problem and not you. Therefore, if you wish to apologize for your part, please say, "I'm sorry cousin ____ that I hurt you. I'm truly sorry. However, you hurt my feelings when you __________." She's your cousin, you love her, and you two are home girls. Don't forget that.

[SEP] question_content: 'To those it may concern' I will be 23yrs 2morrow(5th April)i'm pleading with u to send me some sweet words just to make my day. [SEP] best_answer: Happy 23rd Amu.

F.Y.I.  April 5th, not only marks the anniversary of your birth, but also the beginning of 'Your Adventure'.  It is the point at which 'Your Quest' began.  All the good people that you've known, and all the goodness that you've encountered began on that special day.  

And, since that day, you've blessed the world with your smiles, your insights, and your caring nature.  I've read through some of the answers that you've provided to others in need.  You seem to genuinely care for people, and have a sincere desire to help.  Those qualities are special and rare.  And, no doubt they will be rewarded.

So, smile on Your Special Day.  For, although there may be some sadness in your heart, that heart is big.  Big enough to hold great love, which will find you in due time.

Prose written as a gift to you, in honor of your 23rd Anniversary on Earth: 

Through the mist, 
just out of reach,
A figure looms.

Mirroring my movement.
Watching.
Forever attentive.

Who lies within the shadows, 
shimmering, in the mist?
Do you mock me?

Remove this veil. Come forth,
and break your silence.
Reveal yourself.

"Oh, it is you.  You are me!
Concealing your nature.
Why do you hide?"

" I am you on the 'morrow.
That which you'll become.
Patiently guiding."

"Fear not. I am always here,
with love in my heart.
Ready to help you grow.

Seek me out. In times of 
sorrow and strife.
I will comfort you.

For, none knows you better.
None could ... 
love you more.

question_title: How do you know when your in love? [SEP] question_content: Is it when you feel you can,t life with out the person. or can not stand being with out the person? [SEP] best_answer: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
Some love lasts a lifetime. True love lasts forever.
Those whom true love has held, it will go on holding.
For true love is inexhaustible; the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow. 
We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack. 
 True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked. 
 The energy of Love is the force that binds the world. This is the energy we all exist on. This energy runs through you and you act like a filter for it. When you experience an absence of love or love is lacking in a situation, your filter is unclear. True love is simply experiencing this energy without the distortions of a muddy filter. True love is the acceptance of others without judgment and of course to do this you need to love and accept yourself first.

question_title: What happens to a debt when it has been outstanding for several years & not been paid back to the creditor? [SEP] question_content: I started of really great when I first receive my credit card and lately I've had some struggle with family members who stole and have her friend use it as well. The credit card I have is usually from shopping stores. I still owe money till this day.  This has been an ongoing process that I was paying for about 6-8 months for 8 credit cards. Now, 4 years later, some of those charges has been disputed and of course sent a a collection agency. And most of it has been charged off. I want to know how long does it really takes for your credit to clear up if payments haven't been made to the creditors? Will I ever possibly gain access to ever have a credit card in my life? Help please! [SEP] best_answer: I don't know what planet shaybjones lives on, but that's not how it works around here.  

To answer your question, there are two time frames you need to be aware of.  For your credit report, the bad reports will stay on your credit history for 7 years, starting from the say they went delinquent.

The "statute of limitations" on your debt depends on the state you live in (look at the links below).  Once that day runs out, the creditor can no longer sue you, and you have no legal obligation to pay.

Again, read the links below.  They go into the details of both of these time frames.

You can start cleaning up your credit by following procedures in the Fair Credit Reporting Act.  Protest the listings, and demand that the creditor validates the debt.  Sometimes the listing can be removed through this process (not always).

Start building your credit by getting secured credit cards, or other types of credit cards (department stores).  By making your payments, you will slowly develope your score back up.

question_title: how to get a small business license in the city of martinez ca.? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: To get your business license, you contact

City of Martinez
Business License Department
525 Henrietta Street
Martinez, CA 94553

From the City of Martinez website http://www.cityofmartinez.org/depts/admin/finance/business/default.asp

If you are conducting business from your home within the city limits of Martinez, a completed business application must be sent to the Building and Planning Department for approval. Once approved, the city will provide you with a home occupation certificate. There is a one time fee of $35.00. 

A retail business license fee is bases on the businesses gross receipts for one full year. A Gross Receipt Schedule Form needs to be completed in addition to the business license application. The application must include the businesses resale number. 

Businesses with more than one employee require a Federal and State Tax ID number, which can be obtained through the IRS office.

Federal ID numbers: (800) 829-1040
State ID numbers: (925) 977-8265 

If you are conducting a business using a name other than your own, you will need to file a fictitious name statement, which can be obtained through the Contra Costa County Clerks office at 925-646-2954. 

For further information contact the Business License Department at 925-372-3576.

question_title: How do I change my identity so I can run from the law? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: If you can establish a mailing address under a false name, and if you can get something as simple as a fake drivers license that matches your false name, you can open a bank account in that name. That would be the first step in creating a new identity. If you could also get a fake birth certificate, you could get a real social security number under that false name, or better yet, if you could steal someone's identity, you would be gold - you are what your ID says you are, the only real link to your old life is your fingerprints, and you don't get fingerprinted for jobs, unless you work in a few select industries such as banking.

question_title: Where to find help with grant proposals? [SEP] question_content: i am a single mother trying to start a career in realestat im looking for assistance with government grants do you have any info on grant proposals and how to obtain state funded grants [SEP] best_answer: You can go to the Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance (CFDA) http://www.cfda.gov and Grants.gov http://www.grants.gov - these are two FREE sites created by the federal government to provide transparency and information on grants. Browse through the listings and see if you can find any grant that would support your purposes.

Even if you buy books on "how to get grants" or list that supposedly has information on grants -- all of them are mere rehash of what CFDA has, albeit packaged differently.

Note though that these grants generally support non-profit organizations, intermediary lending institutions, and state and local governments. Most of the federal grants are given to specific target groups with specific requirements (e.g. minority business owners involved in transportation related contracts emanating from DOT - Grant#20.905 Disadvantaged Business Enterprises Short Term Lending Program. Individuals especially for personal purposes are not eligible for federal grants. 

Grants are also often given to non profit groups or organizations involved in training or other similar activities (grant 59.043 Women's Business Ownership Assistance that are given to those who will create women's business center that will train women entrepreneurs 

The government is NOT in the business of giving away free money for the sake of giving away money. Grants are free, but it means OBLIGATION. You will be obligated to do as the grant sets out to do. Grants have objectives, and your purpose must fit the objective of the grant.

For one, you have to write the grant application and the grant application is not a simple document - you have to explain how your purpose for applying for the grant fits well with the objectives set out by the grant. Grants have objectives, and the grant applications that best captures the grant's objectives are approved.

There is a stringent review process through a committee composed of federal employees and selected experts in the field. You will compete with other applicants for the grant money, and this grant review committee will evaluate the merits of each proposal. Only those that they feel exemplifies the objective of the grant will be approved.

question_title: Just Wondering.? [SEP] question_content: I live in the western part of VA. They are going to build a toyota factory near me that will create hundreds of jobs. Many people are against it. But why. Where it is going to be built has nothing there. Its all fields with nothing in them. question_title: Do you agree that single workers are more vulnerable to deceit in the workplace than married workers? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: No, in fact I think it may be the opposite.  I'm single and I think that because I've had deceitful things happen to me by my former girlfriend, I'm more apt to see deceit before it happens.  If someone is happily married, they may be lucky enough to not have someone they love lie to them. Therefore, when someone is trying to deceive them, they may not even suspect it.

  I guess that being single and or married has nothing to do with it. I think that if you've been in a relationship with someone who lies, you are more aware that that kind of thing goes on a lot more than most people think.  Married people may have had that happen in a previous relationship.  And Single people may be lucky enough not to have had that happen.

  I think that people who have been hurt are more likely to see deceit for what it is.

question_title: Do I have to pay taxes on a qdro that I received after my divorce and if so how much? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Investments (that would be addressed with a QDRO) can be defined as pre or post tax investment. 
Pre means that tax was deferred on both the basis ( the initial contribution) and the income. A post tax investment means that the basis was already taxed, so tax is only due on the income. Tradition IRA's and 40lK's ( or similar plans) can have both. 
Roth IRA's are post tax investment where the income accrues free of add'l tax.

In each case, beyond any tax,there are penalties for premature withdrawl. If the funds from the QDRO are transferred into an equivalent IRA or qualified plan, then ther is no penalty and you pay any tax  onlyat the time when you  actually take a distribution. 

If you take a distribution now and do not rollover, you will be required to pay applicable penalties beyond the tax.

question_title: what are the differences of RN and a LPN in terms of salary,working load? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: This is really dependent on where the nurse is working. I have worked in the hospital setting as an LPN where I did the same job as the RN with the exception of giving IV medications. I had the exact same number of patients that my RN counterpart had. \nI have now worked in long-term care as both an LPN and an RN. The work is nearly identical if you work in the capacity of charge nurse. An RN can serve as the Director of Nursing, but an LPN cannot. We employ both LPN's and RN's as supervisors. \nWork load is basically the same. Some jobs require more paperwork, but that is not different because of the job description. Salaries are different depending on where you live and the type of facility you work in. Larger cities often pay more than small towns. There are web sites out there which can give you ballpark salaries for both job descriptions.

I wish you the best of luck...

question_title: How do I sell the house I'm in and use the money to buy another house? [SEP] question_content: The only money I will have is the money I get from selling my present house. [SEP] best_answer: It sounds like you are in the IDEAL situation for what is called a "contingency" agreement. Put your house on the market and start looking for a new house. If you have no income and the only money you have is from the sale of your current house then you can sign a purchase contract with another seller that says you will close on the purchase of their home contingent on the sale of your current property, which, in regular words, means you can buy their house as soon as yours is sold!!!\n\nThere is also the option of a bridge loan. These are secured by the equity of your current house and gets paid in full once your house is sold. These work well but you have to pay interest on them just as you would a regular mortgage. I would speak with a mortgage broker after you get in touch with a real estate agent!!!!

question_title: Please i want some tips om running a home ironing Business? [SEP] question_content: How to go about it if anyone of you have done so. Thanks. [SEP] best_answer: Hello:

Give them a cost analysis of using your services to complete ironing for them as opposed to taking it all to the dry cleaner or hiring a housekeeper.  Also the elderly may be a target market, you could also possibly approach your local coin-op laundry's, ask them if they offer this service and if not ask them if perhaps they can include your card or flyer with their customers bill.  My local coin ops have a pay per pound service to have my laundry done for me, but the only one that will iron is the one that is attached to a dry cleaner (very expensive).

You may want to add other services as well (if you cant do them, maybe you can co-op with other people in your area) like sewing, alterations, laundry, errands etc.

Check out the other links, one is a forum of small business owners, they have a lnk on the left to ask questions and you can look through or post.  The other is Inc magazine, many many great articles on business. Click on "small business" "Start ups" or typr in your business and see if any articles come up.

Good luck

question_title: How do I remove derogatory accounts off my credit score after they have been settled? [SEP] question_content: I have 3 derogatory accounts on my credit score. I have settled them. They were charge offs and I settled them through a collection agency. Is there any way to remove these accounts becasue I think they are absolutely killing my credit score. Also, they have not been reported as being settled yet. I just settled them a month a go. Does anyone know how long it usually takes for the collection agency to report these settlements? Please help. [SEP] best_answer: You have just stumbled into the trap that I have tried warning people about for months now!

There are only two ways to get a negative item removed from your credit history.

1) The creditor must remove it
2) The creditor fails to respond to a credit bureau investigation request.

Once you have paid the creditor, you are going to find it extremely difficult to get them to cooperate in fixing your credit.  

That is why I warn people who are going to pay off old debts...make the creditor agree IN WRITING to delete the entry once the bill has been paid off.  Don't pay them a dime unless they agree to do it.

Now you are broke, and you still have bad credit.  Is that fair?

All you can do now is start the dispute process.  Note that even though you paid off this debt, the creditor is only REQUIRED to show that the debt has been paid off, but it will still show reports of late payments, charge offs and collections.  It will still be a negative report. 

But it at least should show the bill is paid.  Failure of the credit to update your credit history is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act.  If they don't update the listing, you can sue them for $1000 in small claims court.

Send a dispute letter to both the credit bureau and the creditor.  But note that it sometimes takes a couple of months for these updates to show up on your report, so you need to be patient.

question_title: Not knowing much about the stockmarket. If I wanted to buy shares in a mining corp. What should I do? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I think it is not a good idea to buy stock in a single company.  Investing in many companies through mutual funds is less risky.

Asset allocation is the most important investment decision you will make.  How you divide your investments among stocks, bonds, and cash (money markets, etc.) will determine most of the returns you receive.  So long as you maintain a mix of investments, the particular stocks, bonds, and cash instruments in which you invest are of secondary importance.

If it will be more than 5 to 10 years until you use the money, you ought to have very high risk investments; 80% stocks and 20% bonds is appropriate.  If you are within 5 years (10 years if you are very risk-averse) of using your money, gradually switch from 80-20 to 60% stocks, 20% bonds, and 20% cash.  So, when you begin to draw down your investments, such as at the beginning of retirement, you should be at the 60-20-20 allocation.  Gradually change to 10-80-10 within 10 years.  One-fourth of your stocks should be international funds, so long as you have enough in stocks to maintain the minimum balance required for an international fund.

To summarize:
More than 5 or 10 years from using money: 80% stocks, 20% bonds.
At 5 or 10 years away, gradually change to: 60% stocks, 20% bonds, 20% cash.
As you begin drawing down (early retirement): 60-20-20.
Over ten years of retirement gradually change to: 10-80-10.

I'm a big believer in index funds.  A mix of index funds beats 3/4 of managed mutual funds.  I think it is really advisable to read up on the "couch potato portfolio" and the "coffee house portfolio."  Scott Burns discusses these at his web site (free registration).  You can search Google.  They are simple mixes of index funds that only require rebalancing once a year.

Read "Bogle on Mutual Funds."  It shows why index fund investing is the way to go.

question_title: What can I do about a lazy co-worker who keeps messing up at work and keeps leaving things for me to do? [SEP] question_content: I work in a pharmacy so we can't make mistakes like he does!  He is very lazy and leaves some of his work for me to do.  It's not fair.  He's a nice guy and all, but still!  Any suggestions? [SEP] best_answer: DO NOT DO HIS WORK!!!!   

if someone isn't cutting it at work and you get questioned about work not getting done, then inform your supervisor of the problem.  you shouldn't have to do your work and his.  

this is coming from a managment person of many years.  your supervisor may not be aware of his slacking...all your sup may see is that the work is done. 

if he leaves tasks that HAVE to get done by end of day, but are his responsibility, then document this and take the documentation to your supervisor.  explain that you are not complaining, you are simply pointing out that he slacks and you're left with it.  it's unfair and if you are doing more, perhaps you should have better wages, better hours etc.  BUT like i said...don't whine and complain, managers HATE that.  we all feel like we do more than our co workers, however, if you have documentation and show it to your sup in a professional manner and it is clear that he is shirking his responsibilities, then your sup should hear you loud and clear.

good luck and take care!

question_title: Trying to purge file cabinet. What needs to be retained and for how long? [SEP] question_content: What files need to be retained as permanent record? Do telephone and utility billes need to be kept? Do credit card statements need to be filed? [SEP] best_answer: Keep all tax records until the statute of limitation expires; I think it's seven years. Keep all "terms and conditions" type paperwork for any open accounts: insurance, credit cards, mortgage, etc. Keep receipts for major purchases at least until the warranty expires. Keep any records on which there's any hint of a dispute with anyone.

As for monthly statements, keep the most current one for each account, and you can toss the rest as soon as you've reconciled them and verified that you were charged correctly. You may want to keep a credit card statement if there's a purchase on it for which you plan to claim reimbursement (from your employer, etc.)

Whatever you get rid of, be sure to shred!

question_title: what is athema? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I believe you mean "Athematic"

In the Indo-European languages, thematic roots are those roots that have a "theme vowel"; a vowel sound that is always present between the root of the word and the attached inflections. Athematic roots lack a theme vowel, and attach their inflections directly to the root itself.

For example, consider the endings of the Latin "first declension" singular:

Nom. rosa 
Gen. rosae 
Dat. rosae 
Acc. rosam 
Abl. rosâ 

The vowel a seems to be prominent in these case endings, so nouns like rosa came to be known as "a-stem" nouns, with a being the "theme vowel," and was later analysed as having a stem containing a root plus a suffix. In fact, philologists now believe that the suffix in Indo-European was now *-eh2, with a laryngeal that usually became a in the daughter languages.

question_title: Do you feel banks are over regulated or under regulated? also read details? [SEP] question_content: Does this regulation create or solve problems within the industry? [SEP] best_answer: Banks are under-regulated.  One need only look back in the mid 1980's with the failure of S & L's due to deregulation.  Basically, financial services need to be regulated (i.e., deposit insurance, capital requirements, staff reductions at the FHLBB, et. al.) to solve "moral hazard" problems (i.e., taking sub-optimal risks to generate higher returns for investors). question_title: How does Burger King inc. use promotional strategy as a tool? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: You get product promotion and price promotion. 

Product promotion is when you get another product when you make a purchase. An example would be, you purchase a burger and you get another burger free, or you get a movie ticket or a toy (especially in kiddie meals), etc.

Price promotion is when you get a discount on the product you are purchasing. Ex. Buy one and get the second half price, or you get a discount voucher after making a purchase, etc.

Promotion comes into play when you introduce a new product in the market and you want people to try it, when you want to get rid of stock (especially perishable goods, remember most products have a shelf life), when you want to prevent a new competitor from entering the market and establishing themselves.

question_title: How can I redeem myself after this? [SEP] question_content: I went on an interview today at a major NYC advertising agency.  I had interviewed with them before (different position) and did fairly well, but this interview (with another lady) didn't go too well.  During the interview, I ended up asking her what she's looking for in a candidate.  As usual, she said detail-oriented and organized (which I am... I'm very anal about organization).  Now, this is where I screwed up majorly.  Sometimes I'm so blunt, it's horrible.  I ended up saying something along the lines of "Anyone who comes in here is going to tell you they're detail-oriented and organized, but the only way to really verify it is by speaking to past employers."  I didn't mean to come across as a smart@$$ at all, but after I said it, I'm pretty sure that's how it came across.  Is there any way to save myself?  I can't believe I said that. I would have been perfect for the position too. [SEP] best_answer: She may just appreciate your freshness and honesty.  I sure would if you had been interviewing with me.  Don't count it as a lost cause yet.  

It's a good idea to follow up all interviews, even second and third ones, with a letter.  In your letter, state you enjoyed meeting with her and hope that your attention to detail comes through in your crisp letter writing.  Provide examples of your attention to detail and organizational skills.  Did you create an ad campaign that ran in a paper or magazine?  Include a photocopy sample of the ad, and the contact details for your supervisor on that project.  Reiterate in your letter how you can help them - phrase your abilities from their point of view (sample:  You need a creative individual.  My background in fine arts provides ....)  Avoid saying how much you want the job; the letter itself says that.  They want to know what you've told us:  That you would be perfect for the position.  Close the letter with "I look forward to speaking with you again" and warm wishes.  

Don't forget to proofread the letter for style, grammar, and spelling.

question_title: If World War III happened in twenty years, would there be much use of infantry, or just nuclear bombs? [SEP] question_content: Say it was USA versus China.

What defences would there be against such bombs.
Every bomb  used on both sides would destroy hold cities.

So how would it be fought? With what weapons? [SEP] best_answer: Nuclear bombs would be used. But it is recognised that there is a ceiling to the number of bombs that would destroy the Earth utterly. Countries involved would limit strikes to below this number as part of the new nuclear war doctrine. China and the US have vast territories so some civilians and military would survive- China has less than 500 warheads, while the US only has a few thousand ready for use.

If World War III kicks off the theatre will be global and incalculably vast- there would be low level skirmishes all over the place. Hence infantry would be used and see action all over the globe- they have an ability to avoid destruction tanks and planes cannot.

The world would instantly become a more violent place- so other wars of a conventional kind would erupt, and the US would intervene where strategically helpful.

question_title: Does the US military operate its own railroads? [SEP] question_content: I'm sort of an amateur railroad buff, but I don't know much at all about the military. Could someone who knows about both please steer me in the direction about military railroads? I know during the two world wars the military contracted with the civillian railroads to move troops. But what about today? Does the military operate branch railroads to ship things to and from their supply depots (such as Honey Lake in California, Hawthorne in Nevada, Aniston in Alabama, etc)? Does the military actually operate the trains themselves, or do they contract with freight operators like NS, UP, BNSF, and CSX? [SEP] best_answer: Yes the military operates their own railroads. Most of the train crews are civilian employees. I work for a railroad now and I was in the US Air Force for several years around a USAF railroad. The gov't owns track, property, locomotives and rolling stock. They also contract out to several class 1, 2 and 3 railroads to meet the transportation needs. I belive that military railroads are class 3 railroads, basically shortlines. See the link below for pics.

question_title: Why the practice of One-Man-One-Vote in democracy? [SEP] question_content: Is the equity in our respective rights to vote the same as the respective degrees of our rights to vote? Democracy is already discriminatory in importing the concept of "eligibility". So, why not discriminate in the number of votes to be accorded everyone "eligible" to vote? [SEP] best_answer: I guess I'm wondering what the alternative would be??

The "one man, one vote" form of democracy we now enjoy, is only about a century old. Before that, the ability to vote, or the number of votes one could cast, depended on ones wealth and, usually, how much one could pay in taxes.

In 1959, in Baker v. Carr, the Supreme Court said it was a violation of the Fourteenth Amendment's Equal Protection Clause to make one person's vote count less than another's.

question_title: what is the best way to take study-notes on a text? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: General answer -- the way that works best for you to remember the key parts.

Really, the "best way" is different based upon individual learning styles and previous knowledge.

Some common techniques -- read it thoroughly. Summary the main points in your own words, in addition to any quotes you think are important. Really seek to understand the content.

Writing it down longhand (as opposed to typing it) helps if you learn kinesthetically. 

Reading it outloud to yourself, or reading the summaries, helps if you are an auditory learning.

The bottom line is that you need to keep your notes short enough that you can retain them in memory, without missing essential concepts.

question_title: Will you get a ticket for always driving your car in reverse? [SEP] question_content: even if you do it safely [SEP] best_answer: You don't say what state you're in.  If your state has laws about driving in reverse, then you're probably going to get a ticket.

In California, there's no law against driving in reverse per se.  I might try to make an argument that by "always" doing so, you're driving in a reckless manner, and therefore guilting of reckless driving (chances are this would be a bigger ticket than any ticket for driving in reverse).

If you're driving so slow that you're impeding traffic, you might get a ticket for that.  You want to know if you'll get the ticket even if you're driving safely, and I'd suggest that you won't be able to do so...to be safe means you're probably going to have to be slow, and to be slow probably means that you're going to be impeding traffic.

If you're driving in reverse, you won't have brake lights at the rear of your vehicle where they belong.  In California, that's a ticket.

By the same token, you're not going to have headlights where they belong, and at night...that's a ticket.

Mirrors also won't be where they belong, and that's a ticket.

Won't be any wipers on the "front" windshield, and that's a ticket.

The list is nearly endless.

You'd really have to want to prove some kind of point by doing this, and I disagree that it can be done safely for any length of time.

Best answer: go to the local cop shop and ask them how many tickets they can give you for doing it; not *if* they can.

question_title: What is MacCarthyisim and what impaact did it have? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: McCarthyism took place during a period of intense suspicion in the United States primarily from 1950 to 1954, when the U.S. government was actively countering American Communist Party subversion, its leadership, and others suspected of being Communists or Communist sympathizers. During this period people from all walks of life became the subject of aggressive "witch-hunts," often based on inconclusive or questionable evidence. It grew out of the Second Red Scare that began in the late 1940s and is named after the U.S. Senator Joseph McCarthy, a Republican of Wisconsin.

The term originates from March 29, 1950 political cartoon by Washington Post editorial cartoonist Herbert Block. The cartoon depicted four leading Republicans trying to push an elephant (the traditional symbol of the Republican Party) to stand on a teetering stack of ten tar buckets, the topmost of which was labelled "McCarthyism". The reluctant elephant was quoted in the caption as saying "You mean I'm supposed to stand on that?".

Wiki has a good write up of this topic and I would suggest that you read the link that I have given below:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/McCarthyism

Hope that Helps. All the Best. God Bless You

question_title: how can i find out if a murderer has been released without having to pay?? [SEP] question_content: murderer convicted in 1991 to life minimum being 18 years could he be out if so how do i find this out without it costing me? [SEP] best_answer: He can't be out until the 18 year tariff is up. When someone is sentenced to life they are set a "tariff", in this case 18 years, and they can not apply for parole until then and there is no guarantee that it will be granted.  He will be eligible for parole in 2009. \nThe only way to find out if he has been released in to contact the Victim Liaison Unit which is run by the Probation Service. You can not get this information any other way as it will go against the Data Protection Act. If you are not a victim of this murder (e.g. family or friends or witness) you will be unable to get this information. \nSorry if this doesn't help but with all this Human Rights stuff the information is incredibly difficult to get.

question_title: what are the degrees 1st,2nd etc based on for burglary? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Depends on the state but here it is for Colorado:

Burglary - a person enters unlawfully or remains unlawfully in a building or occupied structure with the intent to commit a crime therein against another person or property

1st degree - and while entering or while in the building, or in flight therefrom, assaults or menaces any person or is armed with explosives or deadly weapon

2nd degree - burglary of a dwelling
                     the objective of the theft is a controlled substance (legal drugs such as found in pharmacies)

3rd degree - breaking into a vending machine, safe, cash register, coin vending maching, product dispenser, coin telephone etc

Hope that helps

(p.s dollar amount has to do with theft, because burglary isn't just about money, it can include criminal mischief, theft, etc)

question_title: Why ndidnt the treaty of Versailles pass the Senate? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Actually, the Treaty of Versailles was voted by the Senate, and it was defeated. Instead, the United States negotiated and signed a separate treaty with Germany which led to American soldiers on temporary occupation duty in western Germany for about 4 years.

There were two main problems for the Senate, one personal and one dealing with policy. The personal problem was between President Wilson on one side and Senator Lodge (the Republican leader) on the other. The two had come to an agreement that they would both honor a political truce during the war, where neither side would use the war for electoral purposes, but President Wilson broke the agreement when in the 1918 midterms he campaigned saying that only Democrats would be able to create a lasting world peace. For obvious reasons, Senator Lodge felt betrayed by this, and when the voters actually turned out against President Wilson and voted in a Republican majority in the Senate, the Repbulicans were not in the mood to give a "do-over." To make matters worse, when President Wilson travelled to Europe for the 1919 Peace Conference, he invited only Democrats to come with him, Republican ideas were completely snubbed. When the Treaty was finally signed and brought back to the United States, even though Lodge agreed with many aspects of the final document, the Republicans felt they could not trust President Wilson and made certain that the treaty would be attacked everywhere it was debated across the nation.

The procedural problem was the incorporation of the League of Nations as a vague but permanent part of the treaty and thus a permanent responsibility of the United States. The treaty was very vague and just said that a League would be set up at a future date. Many people were very hesitant to get the United States involved in a world organization where American sovereignty was subordinated to some outside aurthority. During the war, even President Wilson had been very hesitant about this sort of thing, and the United States never actually signed the Entente Cordiale or entered into any permanent agreement with the Western Allies.

In the end, despite a very hard-fought debate which saw President Wilson travel the entire country supporting the Treaty (to be followed by Republican Senators to speak against it after the President left) and eventually led to President Wilson being debilitated by a stroke, the treaty went down to defeat in the US Senate.

It is likely that, especially with President Harding's Normalcy and President Coolidge's ideas of governmental non-intervention outside of Latin America, the United States would not have had a very good experience with the League if the treaty had been approved. The League in the end was built around the colonial asperations of Britain and France and as such had a very hard time reaching meaningful agreements to stop aggression throughout the world.

question_title: How about liberal? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Liberalism is an ideology, philosophy, and political tradition that holds liberty as the primary political value.[1] Broadly speaking, liberalism seeks a society characterized by freedom of thought for individuals, limitations on power, especially of government and religion, the rule of law, the free exchange of ideas, a market economy that supports relatively free private enterprise, and a transparent system of government in which the rights of minorities are guaranteed. In modern society, liberals favour a liberal democracy with open and fair elections, where all citizens have equal rights by law and an equal opportunity to succeed[2]. Liberalism rejected many foundational assumptions which dominated most earlier theories of government, such as the Divine Right of Kings, hereditary status, and established religion. Fundamental human rights that all liberals support include the right to life, liberty, and property. In many countries, "modern" liberalism differs from classical liberalism by asserting that government provision of some minimal level of material well-being takes priority over freedom from taxation. Liberalism has its roots in the Western Enlightenment, but the term now encompasses a diversity of political thought, with adherents spanning a large part of the political spectrum, from left to right. In the context of economics, the term "liberalism" refers to economic liberalism, which is associated with the political ideology of liberalism itself.

As a captive population besieged by Israeli soldiers, Gazans are facing a humanitarian catastrophe sanctioned by Israeli government policy and implemented by the Israeli army. They can ignore Israel's bullying of the international community to connive in the starving of the Hamas-led government of funds and diplomatic room for manoeuvre, thereby preventing the elected Palestinian leadership from running Gaza. They have been "disappeared", doubtless to be be held in administrative detention, where they can denied access to lawyers, the courts and, of course, justice. This attack in Israel, they tell us, is the most serious to date, with the implication that it is therefore illegitimate and part of the same "escalation". Even ignoring the fact that this attack was against Israeli soldiers besieging, imprisoning and shelling the Palestinians of Gaza, does the "international community" not to pause to consider the double standard it is applying? question_title: Can someone explain to me the "freedom of speech"? [SEP] question_content: I'm really confused.. why are the cartoons against the Muslims' prophit are considered "freedom of speech", while David Irving's denial of the Holocaust is not, although he pleaded "guilty"! (check:  http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20060220/wl_nm/austria_irving_dc_4 ) I'm not saying he's right or wrong, I'm just asking why is that not taken as freedom of speech as well? [SEP] best_answer: The government may make no law respecting your freedom of speech. (1st Amendment).  No state may make any law depriving you of your freedom of speech (14th Amendment).  The freedom of speech applies to personal speech, political speech and even to a lesser extent, commercial speech.  In general, no prior restraint may be made against your freedom of speech (Times v. Sullivan).  However, the freedom of speech is not absolute.  You may not exercise freedom of speech when to do so would subject the public to danger (for example, you may not shout "Fire!" in a crowded theater if there is no fire).  This is a synopsis of ideas from the Constitution and many Supreme Court cases.

Your exercise of freedom of speech may not interfere with other constitutionally guaranteed rights. Many cases have addresssed the use of religious symbols in public places as well as actions of political speech such as burning of the American flag. These cases are not always models of consistency.

Suffice it to say that freedom of speech is well protected but not absolute.


In the context of these cartoons and comments, at least in the USA, you can publish these ideas, even if they are offensive to others.  You are really not addressing the "freedom of speech" as such as much as you are addressing editorial judgment of the press.  While the press is free to say what it wants, it ought to consider the sensibilities of others, especially those who might legitimately take offense to the writings or utterances.

question_title: Why is it that people seem to know more about celebrities then their country's government? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Good question.  Probably because celebrities are "glamorous" and more visible than the government.  Following them also requires much less thought and effort than paying attention to the government. If people pay attention to the government, they usually start to get uncomfortable with what they see, so they stay away or they get involved and forget the celebrities.  I hope more people forget the celebrities, who are just human beings like all of us, and start getting involved in the world around them!

question_title: What would be one thing you would do if you were elected to public office? [SEP] question_content: We all want to complain about our government and what they are doing or not doing....so what would you do differently?  How would you make a difference? [SEP] best_answer: Come up with a monumental goal for the country to rally around...in the same vein as President Kennedy's challenge to put American's on the moon.  And then put lots of money and policy change behind meeting that goal.

Suggestions might be to reduce our country's oil usage by 30%  or more by 2012.  Another suggestion might be to land a manned ship on Mars by 2020.  Or find a cure for cancer.  

If we focus all of our resources and efforts on anyone of these goals, we could make significant achievements.  When politicians and political activists start becoming obstructionists we lose that ability and become a stagnant, non-competitive nation.
